meanings.definition: Things of no importance or value.
meanings.sent1: She collected little nothings like pebbles and feathers.
meanings.sent2: The box was filled with trinkets and nothings.
meanings.sent3: He found joy in the small nothings that others overlooked.
meanings.sent4: Her room was cluttered with nothings that held sentimental value.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was full of shiny nothings.

meanings.sent1: In the empty room, there were only echoes of nothings.
meanings.sent2: The silence was filled with the weight of unspoken nothings.
meanings.sent3: The blank page stared back, whispering nothings to the writer.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a void, a vast expanse of forgotten nothings.
meanings.sent5: The darkness enveloped her, swallowing all the nothings in its path.

meanings.sent1: The speech was full of empty nothings, devoid of any real message.
meanings.sent2: The book was a collection of shallow nothings, lacking depth.
meanings.sent3: His promises were mere nothings, disappearing into thin air.
meanings.sent4: The argument crumbled under the weight of its own nothings.
meanings.sent5: The painting was beautiful but lacked substance, a canvas of colorful nothings.
